title: Women wear white to honour Bondi victims | ABC NEWS
description: Women from across Sydney have joined together at Bondi Pavilion at an event organised by the National Council of Jewish Women Australia and New South Wales.  Women from all backgrounds gathered at Bondi Beach wearing white, each with a single flower to honour the victims.   Governor-General Sam Mostyn joined those at the pavilion to pay respects and pledge a commitment to healing.   By Courtney Barrett Peters, ABC News Channel. Social version by David Douglas Stuart for the ABC News Social Media Team.  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Anti-immigration protests held in defiance of calls for unity | ABC NEWS
description: In Sydney and Melbourne, anti-immigration protests were held despite the objection of the prime minister, the states' premiers, and the Jewish community. The former deputy prime minister, Barnaby Joyce, spoke at the Sydney event in defiance of the calls for unity. title: PM booed, NSW premier Minns praised in Jewish leader's opening address | ABC NEWS
description: President of the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, David Ossip, delivered the opening address to the ceremony. He thanked the crowd for attending and showing their solidarity with the Jewish community. Mr Ossip acknowledged the presence of Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, a remark that was met by loud boos from the crowd. The crowd cheered loudly at the mention of NSW Premier Chris Minns. description: President of the NSW Jewish Board of Deputies, David Ossip, has called out Ahmed Al Ahmed's heroism in tackling one of the Bondi gunmen last Sunday at tonight's vigil. title: Prince George joins Prince William in visit to homelessness charity | ABC NEWS
description: Prince William has spread some Christmas cheer with Prince George, taking the young royal into the kitchen of a homeless shelter to serve meals to those in need. In what's become a special family tradition, the future king re-created a special moment he once shared with his mother with his eldest son for a charity very close to his heart. title: Australians observe a minute's silence marking one week since the Bondi terror attack | ABC NEWS
description: Exactly one week on from the Bondi Beach massacre, the nation has paused to remember the victims of Australia's worst terrorist attack. Political and religious leaders were among thousands who gathered at the beach honouring the 15 lives lost, and the many others whose lives have been changed forever. title: WATCH NOW: Special coverage of the Bondi Beach National Day of Reflection | ABC NEWS
description: One week after the Bondi Beach massacre, the nation held a Day of Reflection service at the beach. Political and religious leaders joined thousands to honour the 15 lives lost and those affected by the tragedy. The service featured prayers, speeches, music, candle lighting, and the singing of "Waltzing Matilda." title: 20 Biggest Stories of '25 - Part One
description: What was your favourite Australian sports story of 2025? We are counting down the 20 biggest Aussies tales of the year. In part one there's AFL excellence, a woman who went from doing the dishes at a cafe to top of the world, history in Aussie rules and a beloved national team that discovered its mojo and lost it again.    Subscribe to the ABC Sport Newsletter (https://www.abc.net.au/connect)

title: Brace for long waits and busy airports ahead of Christmas | ABC NEWS
description: Australian airports are gearing up for a very busy school holiday period as people fly around the country and overseas. Travellers are being urged to give themselves enough time at the airport with long wait times expected. title: Deputy AG responds after files pulled from Epstein database | ABC NEWS
description: Todd Blanche, the Trump Administration's deputy attorney general, says an image removed from an online collection of the Jeffrey Epstein files was due to concerns raised by victims and lawyers and not because it included a photo of Donald Trump. It comes as both Democrats and Republicans threaten legal action and contempt charges against Attorney General Pam Bondi. title: Alan Kohler on robots and the future of work | ABC News
description: The continuing rise of artificial intelligence was one of the big stories of 2025. But how long until humanoid robots, with an AI brain, step into the limelight and take our jobs?   This week, Sam Hawley is joined by ABC presenters and journalists to discuss their best stories and interviews from the past year.    Today, ABC finance presenter and commentator, Alan Kohler, looks at Elon Musk's robot ambitions, how robots could be the new slaves, and what it could mean for all of us.   Do we need a Universal Basic Income, can we tax robot and AI companies to pay for it and why professional sports player may be one job that's safe for a while yet.

title: AI-detector systems falsely accusing students of cheating | ABC NEWS
description: Some Australian schools are using tools to detect whether students are using AI to generate school assignments and they're wrongly accusing students. One parent says the process for appealing the decisions is flawed, and the accusations can be traumatic for the students. title: US envoy Steve Witkoff says talks with Ukraine 'constructive' | ABC NEWS
description: US special envoy Steve Witkoff recently met with officials from Ukraine and Russia in Florida, describing the peace talks as productive.  Witkoff's discussions included separate meetings with Vladimir Putin's envoy and Jared Kushner, President Trump's son-in-law, focused on a proposed 20-point peace plan to end the war. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy found the talks constructive, while the Kremlin expressed scepticism. title: 'Dead zones' prompt tour operator to fund marine study of D'Entrecasteaux | ABC NEWS
description: For more than two decades, Rob Pennicott has taken tourists to see the D'Entrecasteaux Channel. But what he describes as "dead zones" have him so worried that he is funding a study to find what is going wrong.
